ygData.subject: Re: Troll SK questions
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, I don t know what day this was sent, but I went to Splitpaw Friday night.  The lag in the Karanas was terrible. I had a mage-type cast invis on me before
ygData.messageBody:
Well, I don't know what day this was sent, but I went to
Splitpaw Friday night. The lag in the Karanas was
terrible. I had a mage-type cast invis on me before I
went through S.Karana alone.
Splitpaw sucked major sh**. I was there the 1st night at
peak gaming hours and there were only 5 people in he
entire dungeon. 3 of those were 25th +. The second was
a 16th level half-elf (don't remember what class, but
she could heal). We grouped and I died in the 1st fight
with the commander and Rex Ren. Thank Thule I was bound
in Oggok and not Neriak!
The next day I was solo (and the only one in it) most of
the time and I learned the dungeon by heart very
quickly. I hardly got any XP for all the gnolls I
killed, but faction adjustment with the residents and
Qeynos guards went up... not sure how much though. I did
get good loot (cloth armor) and cash from the guard
gnolls though. I was tempted to try the very back room
with the 4 Shaman in it, but they all conned blue to me
and I knew better than that!
Wandering around a 17+ zone (S.Karana) didn't make me
feel very comefortable so I returned to South Ro after
getting bound in Grobb. Looks like I'll be killing
Dervs for a while. :(

Where besides Commonlands Oasis and Ro would be a good
place for a 15th level SK to get to/adventure solo while
looking for a group? KoS is a big factor here. :)

--
Cronik <Brethren of ill Omen>
Left Hand of Thule the Pain Bringer
15th Season Troll SK
Bertoxxulous

"Greenbloods jus be Froglok trick. Smash'm and dey
blood same color a Froglok. Me smash'm Greenblood
for Thule. Thule make Cronik big feared. Make
smash'm fun."



>From: WildMage79@...
>
>ok i am a Troll Shadow Knight level 27, i fought in South Karana
a long
>time, one thing, aviaks will attack you on sight, another while
fighting
>aviaks watch out for Treants that roam they area, which are KOS to
you. Int
>does not matter when fighting, the dark elf may have had a higher
dexterity
>then you, and also the distance from your attacking from affects
it some too
>
